Languages  
Arabic: native  
French: bilingual  
English: fluent  
German: basic  
 
CAREER SUMMARY  
 
2009 to date INEO S 
 
2021 to 2022  
Position: Asset Support Engineer – PolyEthylene Gas Phase Process  
• Technical support and trou bleshooting to INEOS assets and clients (20 -50t/h),  
• Daily data monitoring, in -depth investigations, datamining, and statistical analyses for process 
optimisation on a short or long -term basis,  
• Plant design, review, and modification, variable cost impro vement studies,  
• Interface with plant operation manager, business stakeholders, suppliers,  
• Feasibility studies for new products.  
 
2009 to 2020  
Position: Catalyst Development Engineer – PolyEthylene Catalysts  
 • Lead R&D projects related t o Ziegler/Natta, Chromium and Metallocene catalysts for PE 
production in Gas Phase and Slurry processes,  
• Interface with product specialists, process engineers, tech. service, and salespeople,  
• Market assessment (IP, competition), participate in business  strategy consultations,  
• Interface between suppliers, clients, and research partners,  
• Design of experiments at lab scale – autoclave or H.T.E. – and pilot scale (200kg/h),  
• Support to catalyst manufacturing, and responsible for Q.C.  
• Technical suppor t to pilot and industrial plants, handle catalyst claims,  
• Responsible for powder flowability characterisation: assessment for process & plant design to 
avoid arching or funnel flow risk,  
• Team management (up to 4 lab technicians),  
• Design and implement ation of lab -scale reactors,  
• Responsible for maintenance, reliability, and quality control.  
 
2006 – 2009 IFP Lyon & LCOMS  
Position: PhD. Scientist – Catalysts for Selective Hydrogenation of PyGas  
• Development of novel bimetallic Ni -based catalysts using well -defined surface organometallic  
chemistry grafting techniques  
• Analytical techniques and surface characterisations using gas adsorption and desorption, 
magnetic measurements, EXAFS, TEM, EDS, XRD, GC, in situ IR, GCMS, TGA…  
• Design bench -scale reactor and adapted protocol for catalyst  testing,  
• Scientific conferences and publications (peer -reviewed articles and patents).  
 
2006 IFP Lyon  
Position: Research Engineer (internship) – H.D.S. Catalysts  (6 months)  
• Preparation of supported catalysts for hydrodesulphurisation reactions (Ni -Cobased catalysts),  
• Modification of catalysts to tune selectivity and enhance activity,  
• Characterization of physical properties and development of specific chemisorption protoc ols 
(O2/CO/H2S) for characterisation of surface species and assessment of catalysts’ active sites.  
 
2005 Nat. Chem. Lab. Pune India  
Position: Research Scientist (internship) – Homogenous Catalysis  
• Pd-catalyzed Heck coupling reactions  
• Synthesis of catalysts with diphosphine ligands baring different bite -angles  
• Kinetic study of bench -scale reacti ons – GC analyses.  
 
 
COMMENT  
 
Skills profile  
 
Technical  
A solution -oriented chemical engineer and PhD, with more than 15 years of experience in catalyst 
development and process optimisation projects. Strong background in catalyst synthesis, 
characterisation, and testing. Expert in Ethylene polymerisat ion catalysis and process. Proven 
communication skills with oral or written presentations adapted to target audience.  
 
 Social  
Excellent team player, with proven adaptability in multi

career_advancement: Focus on building core technical skills
Seek mentorship from senior team members
Take on challenging projects to gain experience
